original: 'dir sbyor bar byed pa ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: 'dir sbyor bar byed pa ni 'di yin no //
translated: Here, this is the application.

original: nyon mongs stobs rnams kun du 'dzoms par byed //
analyzed: nyon mongs stobs rnams kun du 'dzoms par byed //

original: zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: lus dang sems kyi rgyun nyon mongs par byed pas nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //

translated: Their power is that by whose power all migrating beings become greatly engaged in not knowing what to travel to and what not to travel to, what is beneficial and what is not beneficial, what is heavy and what is light, and so on.

analyzed: de 'joms par byed pa ni mi sdug pa la sogs pa bsgom pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi sa zil gyis gnon par byed pa ste /

original: mdor na nyon mongs pa la dbang bas de dag nyid byang chub kyi yan lag tu sgom par byed pa'o //
analyzed: mdor na nyon mongs pa la dbang bas de dag nyid byang chub kyi yan lag tu sgom par byed pa'o //
translated: In brief, they are the branches of enlightenment because they have power over the afflictions.

analyzed: bdud ces bya ba ni lha'i bu la sogs pa ste /

original: de rnams kyi stobs ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la sogs pa la bar chad byed par nus pa de stobs med par rab tu byed pa ni mngon par shes pa'i stobs kyis gzi brjid med cing mthu med par byed ces bya bar sgrub cing ngo //

translated: The powers of those are the ability to create obstacles for the bodhisattva's practice, etc. Making them powerless is making them powerless and ineffective through the power of the superknowledges.

original: bzang po spyod pa'i stobs kun rdzogs par bgyi //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bzang po spyod pa'i stobs kun rdzogs par bgyi // zhes bya ba la /
translated: They complete all the powers of good practice.

original: bzang po spyod pa'i stobs ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zil gyis mi non pas lhun gyis grub par 'jug pa nyid do //
analyzed: bzang po spyod pa'i stobs ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zil gyis mi non pas lhun gyis grub par 'jug pa nyid do //
translated: The powers of good practice are the spontaneous engagement because they are not overcome by counteragents.

original: kun zhes bya ba ni de ma lus pa'o //
analyzed: kun zhes bya ba ni de ma lus pa'o //
translated: All means without exception.

original: rdzogs par bgyi zhes bya ba ni sdar brjod pa rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs la sogs pa rnams bcu dang / bshad ma thag pa'i gnyen po rnam pa gsum po 'dis rdzogs par bgyi ba'o //

translated: The phrase to perfect refers to the ten powers of the superknowledges and so on, which are mentioned in the sutra, and to the three kinds of antidotes that have just been explained.

analyzed: da ni rnam pa bcu bzhi pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi las gang yin pa de ston no //
translated: Now, the fourteen kinds of activities of the bodhisattvas are taught.

analyzed: las de yang sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong ba la sogs pa rnam pa brgyad tshig su bcad pa gnyis kyis gsungs pa ni /
translated: And those activities are the eight kinds of activity, such as purifying the buddhaverse. These are stated in two verses.

original: zhing rnams rgya mtsho zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: zhing rnams rgya mtsho zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: They are the verses beginning with ‚ÄúThe ocean of buddhaverses.‚Äù

original: bde ba can dang padma can la sogs pa lta bu sangs rgyas kyi zhing rgya mtsho skad cig re re la rnam par dag par byed pa dang / de bzhin du 'khor ba'i @178a * //
analyzed: bde ba can dang padma can la sogs pa lta bu sangs rgyas kyi zhing rgya mtsho skad cig re re la rnam par dag par byed pa dang / de bzhin du 'khor ba'i @178a * //
translated: In each instant, he purifies the ocean of buddhaverses, such as the Blissful Land and the Lotus Land, and so on.

analyzed: btson rar nyon mongs pa'i lcags sgrog gi 'ching bas nye bar bcings pa'o //

analyzed: sems can rgya mtsho snyed la rdzu 'phrul dang / kun brjod pa'i cho 'phrul gnyis kyis mgu bar byas nas rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul gyis rnam par grol bar byed pa dang / chos rnams rgya mtsho zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i chos rgya mtsho dang /
translated: The oceans of phenomena refers to the ocean of the Dharma of statements and the ocean of the Dharma of realization.

original: rtogs pa'i chos rgya mtsho rnams shes rab kyi mig gis skad cig so so la mthong bar byed /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i chos rgya mtsho rnams shes rab kyi mig gis skad cig so so la mthong bar byed /
translated: They see with the eye of wisdom each and every instant.

original: lta bar byed pa dang / shes bya mtha' yas pa nyid kyis ye shes mtha' yas pa yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: lta bar byed pa dang / shes bya mtha' yas pa nyid kyis ye shes mtha' yas pa yin pa de bas na /
translated: Since objects of knowledge are limitless, wisdom is limitless.üîΩ Therefore, they are called oceans of wisdom. They engage and realize those oceans of wisdom in each and every instant. This is what is meant by the phrase they see directly.

original: ye shes rgya mtsho zhes gsungs pa'i ye shes rgya mtsho de dag skad cig so so la 'jug cing rtogs par byed pa de mngon du mthong ba zhes bya ba'i don dang / spyod pa rgya mtsho zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni byang chub kyi spyod pa rgya mtsho dang /
analyzed: ye shes rgya mtsho zhes gsungs pa'i ye shes rgya mtsho de dag skad cig so so la 'jug cing rtogs par byed pa de mngon du mthong ba zhes bya ba'i don dang / spyod pa rgya mtsho zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni byang chub kyi spyod pa rgya mtsho dang /
translated: As for the phrase oceans of conduct, and so on, the oceans of bodhisattva conduct refers to the bodhisattvas' conduct of the six perfections.

analyzed: gnyis ka yang sangs rgyas thob par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //

translated: However, there is just this difference: one is direct and the other is indirect.
